acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since its 72-hour EC50 = 41mg/L for algae (Scenedesmus subspicatus) (IUCLID, 2000), the substance was classified into Category 3.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: The classification is based on the description that its rabbit LD50 is > 20000 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The classification is based on the description that its rat LD50 is 10700 mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: In 2-year mixed diet administration tests using rats (IUCLID (2001)), no increase in incidences of tumorigenesis was noted. However, due to insufficient data available, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Its classification for acute toxicity is Category 3, it is rapidly degradable (14-day BOD degradability = 70% (Biodegradation and Bioconcentration of Existing Chemical Substances under the Chemical Substances Control Law, 1993)), and its potential for bioaccumulation is presumably low (logPow = 0.46 (PHYSPROP Database, 2008)). Based on this information, the substance was classified into the "Not classified" category.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Regarding in vitro tests, both Ames tests (NTP DB (accessed in October 2008)) and chromosomal aberration tests yielded negative results (IUCLID (2000)). However, since no in vivo test results are available, classification is not possible.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance contains oxygen (but not fluorine or chlorine) which is chemically bonded only to carbon or hydrogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Its autoignition point is 740degC, which is above 70degC.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In reproduction toxicity tests using guinea pigs that underwent mixed diet administration, no adverse effects were noted on growth of the first generation animals and on fertility or lactation of the second generation animals (JECFA SERIES 6 (1975)). However, since sufficient test details are not provided, classification is not possible based on this study.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since rabbit tests found that the substance has severe effect (PATTY (5th, 2001)), and it is rated as R36 in the EU classification.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since 12-hour exposure tests using rabbits found that the substance causes mild irritation (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified into the "Not classified" category using the JIS classification criteria (Category 3 in the United Nations classification).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Guinea pig maximization tests found that the substance is not sensitizing (IUCLID (2000)), which indicates that the substance falls under the "Not classified" category. However, since these are List 2 studies, classification is not possible.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In 2-year mixed diet administration tests using dogs, no abnormalities were noted in terms of blood biochemical examinations, organ weights, and histopathological examinations (JECFA SERIES 6 (1975)) at the dose of 1250 mg/kg, which is higher than Category 2 guidance values. In 1 to 2 year mixed diet administration tests using rats, no adverse effects were noted in histopathological examinations on bones, the liver, kidney, spleen, and stomach in 0.1-1% dose groups (JECFA SERIES 6 (1975)). In addition, 75 people received 500 mg of this substance daily for one year without any toxic symptoms or abnormalities in terms of red blood cells, white blood cells, proteins, creatinine level, liver functions, or kidney functions measured in blood biochemical examinations (JECFA SERIES 6 (1975)). These reports indicate that the substance falls under the "Not classified" category for oral route, however, no test results through other administration routes are available. Thus, classification is not possible due to insufficient data available.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
